4980.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ

4981.verse-english: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.

4982.verse-english: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].

clauses-english.clause: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].

4983.verse-english: When the earth is shaken with convulsion

clauses-english.clause: When the earth is shaken with convulsion

4984.verse-english: And the mountains are broken down, crumbling

clauses-english.clause: And the mountains are broken down,

4987.verse-english: Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?

clauses-english.clause: Then the companions of the right -
what are the companions of the right?

4988.verse-english: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the left -
what are the companions of the left?

4990.verse-english: Those are the ones brought near [to Allah]

clauses-english.clause: Those are the ones brought near [to God]

4992.verse-english: A [large] company of the former peoples

clauses-english.clause: A [large] company of the former peoples

4993.verse-english: And a few of the later peoples,

clauses-english.clause: And a few of the later peoples,

4995.verse-english: Reclining on them, facing each other.

4996.verse-english: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal

clauses-english.clause: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal

4997.verse-english: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -

clauses-english.clause: pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -

4998.verse-english: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -

clauses-english.clause: No headache will they have therefrom,

4999.verse-english: And fruit of what they select

clauses-english.clause: And fruit of what they select

5000.verse-english: And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.

5001.verse-english: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,

clauses-english.clause: And [for them are] fair women with large,

5003.verse-english: As reward for what they used to do.

clauses-english.clause: As reward for what they used to do.

5004.verse-arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
5004.verse-english: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -

clauses-arabic.clause: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا

clauses-english.clause: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -

5006.verse-english: The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?

clauses-english.clause: what are the companions of the right?

5007.verse-english: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed

clauses-english.clause: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed

5014.verse-english: Indeed, We have produced the women of Paradise in a [new] creation

clauses-english.clause: We have produced the women of Paradise in a [new] creation

5016.verse-english: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,

clauses-english.clause: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,

5017.verse-english: For the companions of the right [who are]

clauses-english.clause: For the companions of the right [who are]

5018.verse-english: A company of the former peoples

clauses-english.clause: A company of the former peoples

5019.verse-english: And a company of the later peoples.

clauses-english.clause: And a company of the later peoples.

5020.verse-english: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the left -
what are the companions of the left?

5021.verse-english: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water

clauses-english.clause: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water

5022.verse-english: And a shade of black smoke,

clauses-english.clause: And a shade of black smoke,

5024.verse-english: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,

5025.verse-english: And they used to persist in the great violation,

clauses-english.clause: And they used to persist in the great violation,

5026.verse-arabic: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
5026.verse-english: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

clauses-english.clause: "When we die and become dust and bones,
are we indeed to be resurrected?

5028.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, the former and the later peoples

clauses-english.clause: the former and the later peoples

5029.verse-english: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."

clauses-english.clause: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day.

5030.verse-english: Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,

5031.verse-english: Will be eating from trees of zaqqum

clauses-english.clause: Will be eating from trees of zaqqum

5032.verse-english: And filling with it your bellies

clauses-english.clause: And filling with it your bellies

5033.verse-english: And drinking on top of it from scalding water

clauses-english.clause: And drinking on top of it from scalding water

5034.verse-english: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.

clauses-english.clause: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.

5035.verse-english: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.

clauses-english.clause: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.

5036.verse-english: We have created you, so why do you not believe?

clauses-english.clause: so why do you not believe?

5037.verse-english: Have you seen that which you emit?

clauses-english.clause: Have you seen that which you emit?

5038.verse-english: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?

clauses-english.clause: Is it you who creates it,

5039.verse-arabic: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ الْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
5039.verse-english: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone

clauses-english.clause: We have decreed death among you,
and We are not to be outdone

5040.verse-arabic: عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
5040.verse-english: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.

clauses-arabic.clause: عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ

clauses-english.clause: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.

5041.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
5041.verse-english: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?

clauses-english.clause: And you have already known the first creation,

5042.verse-english: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?

clauses-english.clause: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?

5043.verse-english: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?

clauses-english.clause: Is it you who makes it grow,

5044.verse-arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَاهُ حُطَامًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
5044.verse-english: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,

clauses-english.clause: and you would remain in wonder,

5047.verse-english: And have you seen the water that you drink?

clauses-english.clause: And have you seen the water that you drink?

5048.verse-arabic: أَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ الْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنزِلُونَ
5048.verse-english: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?

clauses-english.clause: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds,
or is it We who bring it down?

5049.verse-arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
5049.verse-english: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?

clauses-english.clause: so why are you not grateful?

5050.verse-english: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

clauses-english.clause: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

5051.verse-arabic: أَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنشِئُونَ
5051.verse-english: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?

clauses-english.clause: Is it you who produced its tree,

5052.verse-english: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,

clauses-english.clause: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,

5053.verse-english: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

clauses-english.clause: So exalt the name of your Lord,

5054.verse-english: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,

clauses-english.clause: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,

5055.verse-english: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.

5056.verse-english: Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an

5058.verse-english: None touch it except the purified.

clauses-english.clause: None touch it except the purified.

5059.verse-english: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

5060.verse-english: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent

clauses-english.clause: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent

5061.verse-english: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?

clauses-english.clause: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?

5062.verse-english: Then why, when the soul at death reaches the throat

clauses-english.clause: when the soul at death reaches the throat

5063.verse-english: And you are at that time looking on -

clauses-english.clause: And you are at that time looking on -

5064.verse-arabic: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
5064.verse-english: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -

clauses-english.clause: And Our angels are nearer to him than you,

5065.verse-english: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,

clauses-english.clause: if you are not to be recompensed,

5066.verse-english: Bring it back, if you should be truthful?

5067.verse-english: And if the deceased was of those brought near to Allah,

clauses-english.clause: And if the deceased was of those brought near to God,

5068.verse-english: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.

clauses-english.clause: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.

5069.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
5069.verse-english: And if he was of the companions of the right,

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ

clauses-english.clause: And if he was of the companions of the right,

5070.verse-english: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."

clauses-english.clause: [you are] from the companions of the right.

5071.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ
5071.verse-english: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ

clauses-english.clause: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,

5072.verse-english: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water

clauses-english.clause: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water

5074.verse-english: Indeed, this is the true certainty,

5075.verse-english: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

clauses-english.clause: So exalt the name of your Lord,
